page.title: 06C L U B S
page.content: There are two{Village Halls}serving this area. The hall at{Stanford-on-Teme}was originally the Village School and on closure was given to the villagers residing in Stanford and Orleton by the Winnington family, to be used solely as a village hall - many and varied social functions are held here throughout the year. The other hall at{Upper Sapey}was built in the late nineteen forties in memory of Edith Silcocks, a former headmistress of Sapey School - the {Sapey Cricket Club}are the main users. A{Darts Club}and a{Rifle Shooting {Club}are based at the Stanford Bridge Hotel.
